title: Maestro75
author: Maestro75
content: Two weeks ago, some one talked to me about this mining site called the Happyminer and how I can make passive income from setting it up on my phone. This is the website www.happyminer.us It looks good and the person who told me about it is someone with a deep knowledge about cryptocurrency. My confusion is that alot of people in this forum have said mining sites are not good and are mostly scam sites but this site am given looks good. Because of that I do not know how to conclude this if it is real or fake. Can someone help me out. I do not want to go on a journey to waste my time with it. I need your help on it. Has anyone used this site before? Is it real?And please moderators can move this topic if this board is the wrong place for it.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: I would be very careful about this "someone" who talked you into this. Surely someone with "deep knowledge about cryptocurrency" would know this is a scam as it is pretty obvious you would only need to rely on one's common sense. Just saying because scam DMs are pretty rampant where someone pretends to be doing you a favor when they're actually luring you to a lion's den.A common characteristic of ponzi scheme/scams are the extremely high profits as that would mean it's unsustainable. 3% daily is 90% monthly and 2% daily is 60% - these rates are in dream land. On their FAQ, they're advertising this as entirely risk free investment and there is no such thing, every investment has risk. And as pointed out above, if we apply this in actual mining, the more reason it doesn't make sense.

I suggest remove the link above because if you didn't it will help to have backlinks here and rank up on the SERP.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Classic ponzi scheme pretending to be a cloudmining site. Stay away from it at all costs.Some Redditor asked them a question about their hash power and what he discovered is pretty interestingQuote from: https://www.reddit.com/r/CryptoScamBlacklist/comments/120hdqz/happyminer_is_legit_real_mining_or_fake_scam/Here's one of the answers from their support bot:"As ASIC are the most energy-efficient miners, we use them since they dominate the market. Our hash power can reach 471700 GH/s, making us one of the leading providers. Furthermore, our mining farms are equipped with state-of-the-art supercomputers and cooling systems that are extremely efficient."So their entire mining operation is a measly 471.7 th/s and yet they offer physically impossible returns? (For those who are unfamiliar, the profit from mining bitcoin at 471 th/s without even subtracting any power or maintenance costs is currently about 35 bucks a day, that's something someone would have in their garage as a hobby)Ofc email support never answered to explain to me how this math works for them.You can use this calculator to see how much their hashrate which makes them the "leading providers" bring them per day even at zero power costs - https://minerstat.com/coin/BTC

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: it looks like a common cloud-mining/pyramid scam that has been plaguing crypto enthusiasts for years now. I see a lot of similar schemes being posted, advertised and being hyped by fake accounts on Facebook where they offer a "mining package" with guaranteed return profit and daily rate which you can buy for a certain amount of money. I suggest you just ignore it, there is no point wasting time on something that is obviously a scam.
